Comment: Gang violence is political in the sense that anything concerning structures of power is political.  A criminal organization whose income is tied to their territories will want to expand. The more territory, the more customers for their services and the more clients under their "protection." In a city with multiple gangs, turf wars will occur when changes in relative strength or new opportunities upset the status quo.

Comment: Crips & bloods are basically a kind of nationalism that emerges on a micro-scale. You're born in a particular neighborhood and you must wear a particular color to rep your hood / show loyalty / pledge allegiance. Your gang is like an army to "protect" you against neighboring gangs you don't trust.  Besides bloods/crips, there are other types of gangs that are more exclusive (cult-like instead of nation-like).
